topic_or_construct: Attitudes toward individuals with sexual convictions
justification: The Materials section states that the ATS-21 "consists of 21 statements related to individuals with sexual convictions" and that "higher scores indicate more positive attitudes," indicating it is the instrument used to measure attitudes toward this population.

The article describes the PSO as "a revised version of the Community Attitudes to Sex Offenders scale" containing 20 items that tap three sub-domains—Sentencing and Management, Stereotype Endorsement, and Risk Perception—showing it is the scale used to measure these facets of perceptions about sex offenders.

topic_or_construct: Risk judgment about hypothetical sexual-offense cases
measured_by: Eight-item risk-judgement scale (study-created, based on VRS-SO factors)
justification: Under ‘Risk Judgements with Confidence Rating’ the authors explain they used "an eight-item scale that was purpose-created for this study" to have participants rate the risk level of the vignette offender, indicating this bespoke scale operationalised risk judgment.

Immediately after the eight risk-judgement items, participants "were asked to rate their confidence in their risk judgements using one item which could range from 0 (not at all confident) to 5 (extremely confident)", showing this single item served as the measure of confidence.
